items.text: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept, when we remembered Zion.
items.plainText: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept, when we remembered Zion.

items.text: We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.
items.plainText: We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.

items.text: For there they that carried us away captive required of us a song; and they that wasted us required of us mirth, saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.
items.plainText: For there they that carried us away captive required of us a song; and they that wasted us required of us mirth, saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.

items.text: How shall we sing the LORD's song in a strange land?
items.plainText: How shall we sing the LORD's song in a strange land?

items.text: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget her cunning.
items.plainText: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget her cunning.

items.text: If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.
items.plainText: If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.

items.text: Remember, O LORD, the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said, Rase it, rase it, even to the foundation thereof.
items.plainText: Remember, O LORD, the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said, Rase it, rase it, even to the foundation thereof.

items.text: O daughter of Babylon, who art to be destroyed; happy shall he be, that rewardeth thee as thou hast served us.
items.plainText: O daughter of Babylon, who art to be destroyed; happy shall he be, that rewardeth thee as thou hast served us.

items.text: Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones against the stones.
items.plainText: Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones against the stones.
